SEARCH
Package graph

Interface Graph

All Known Implementing Classes:
AdjacencyListGraph, AdjacencyMatrixGraph, IncidenceMatrixGraph
public interface Graph
The Graph interface represents an unweighted directed graph data structure. It provides methods for adding and removing vertices and edges, retrieving neighbors of a vertex, reading a graph from a file, and getting a list of all vertices.

    • getNeighbors

      List<Integer> getNeighbors(int vertex)
      Returns a list of neighbors of the specified vertex. The neighbors are the vertices that are directly reachable from the specified vertex via outgoing edges.

      If the specified vertex does not exist in the graph, this method throws an IllegalArgumentException. Implementations must ensure that this behavior is consistent across all graph types.

      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex whose neighbors are to be returned
      Returns:
      a list of neighboring vertices
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vertex does not exist in the graph

    • getVertices

      List<Integer> getVertices()

      Returns:

    • equals

      boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares the specified object with this graph for equality. Returns true if and only if the specified object is also a graph, both graphs have the same set of vertices and the same set of edges.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be compared for equality with this graph.
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is equal to this graph.

    • hashCode

      int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code value for this graph. The hash code is computed based on the sets of vertices and edges.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash code value for this graph.
